qas.question: What PC operating system is required to stream content to a 360?

answers.text: Windows XP with Service pack 2 or higher

qas.question: What modified AV protocol does the 360 utilize?
What codecs are supported for 360 streaming from uShare?
What video formats are supported for UPnP streaming?
A Service pack 2 or higher prevents what?
What type of server does a Windows XP have?
Which formats does UPnP not support?
The service pack number needs to be lower than what to work with Xbox 360?

context: Music, photos and videos can be played from standard USB mass storage devices, Xbox 360 proprietary storage devices (such as memory cards or Xbox 360 hard drives), and servers or computers with Windows Media Center or <a0_0>Windows XP with Service pack <b8_0>2<b8_0/> or higher<a0_0/> within the local-area network in <b4_0>streaming<b4_0/> mode. As the Xbox 360 uses a modified version of the <a1_0>UPnP<a1_0/> AV protocol, some alternative <b5_0>UPnP<b5_0/> servers such as uShare (part of <b6_0>the GeeXboX project<b6_0/>) and MythTV can also stream media to the Xbox 360, allowing for similar functionality from non-Windows servers. This is possible with video files up to HD-resolution and with several codecs (<a2_0>MPEG-2, MPEG-4, WMV<a2_0/>) and container formats (<a3_0><b7_0>WMV, MOV, TS<b7_0/><a3_0/>).
